lender.name: Marty
lender.loan_because: To try to help to make the world a better place for somebody who really needs my assistance.
lender.occupational_info: I work in the Solid Waste Collection business. My company picks up the garbage; and I manage a book of business.

lender.name: Marie
lender.loan_because: I am also a business owner and know the value of a loan to start and grow a business. I started with a $190,000 loan in 1990 to buy a historic home to rent out for weddings and other events. I now have 2 houses and several other related side businesses that are worth over $4.5 million with an annual income of over $1.4 million. I mostly want to help other women start and grow business not only to help their lives and families but also to become respected business owners and great examples in their communities.
lender.occupational_info: I own 2 buildings which I rent out to people for their weddings and other events. I also provide many of the other items they need such as tables, chairs, linens, tableware, etc. for these events. I expanded my business to also include 2 rooms for overnight accommodations, sales of invitations, honeymoon travel and full service event planning. I have 8 full time and 30 part time employees. I have won many awards and have become an important and respected business person in my community and my business has become one of the most respected in the wedding and event industry in my state of Colorado USA. I am married and have a 22 year old son who also works for me part time while he attends collage. My son and his girlfriend live on the same 10 acre property as my business, myself and my husband built a beautiful home on this same property and I am currently in the process of building my parents new home here as well. I have a 5 year collage degree in design and love what I do!

lender.name: Tim
lender.loan_because: I want to help hard-working people who need assistance in improving their lives. We all have a moral obligation to lend a helping hand to those who are less fortunate.
lender.occupational_info: I counsel and encourage people who are wanting to live without religion

I still remember a time not so long ago, when a few hundred dollars could make a tremendous difference in a person's life.
Today in the United States, it seems that we have lost sight of the values that our country was founded on. In order to be successful nowdays in this crazy fast-paced economy, one must have thousands of dollars just to get started in any business.
It is wonderfully refreshing to see that just a few dollars, about the same amount that many of us spend on an evening out on the town, or even less, can make an incredibly positive impact on the lives of hard working people all over the world.
I am happy to be able to make a difference in their lives.
lender.occupational_info: I interview people to gather data used by the United States Government.

lender.loan_because: I've been working as an international development consultant for the past several years and am fortunate to have first hand experience with the benefits of micro lending. Micro finance institutions (MFIs) must scramble for funding, generally from donors, and the Kiva approach of brokering loans from private individuals brings a taste of business discipline to the process of helping people help themselves through loans that are expected to be repaid.

lender.occupational_info:
I am a Software Engineer by trade, consulting and releasing software under the moniker Astrient Labs. Much of my consulting work involves building mobile applications for USA-based start-up companies. Through Astrient Labs, my sole-proprietorship (one person company), I develop and maintain CutieQs.com, HostJ2ME.com, and WorldDeveloper.og.
Recently my wife and I began the Astrient Foundation. The Astrient Foundation supports social innovation through scholarships, fellowships, and direct donations. Our first iteration is based in Accra, Ghana.
